Reviews.Title: Great Overall Lightweight/Slim Laptop
Reviews.Author: B. Bonville
Reviews.Content: My review is going to be in sections about each feature or aspect of the laptop and then an overall thought about it.Size: This is a nice portable, not too small not too big laptop. I carry it in my backpack to and from school and I can not feel a difference between this and a small text book. It's nice not having to lug my 6 year old hp around anymore.Screen: On the highest brightness setting the screen is very bright and well lit. Lowest brightness setting will save some battery life and it's not too low where you cant see anything but just perfect. The led screen is much brighter, more energy efficient and gives a better picture when watching movies or playing games compared to the older fluorescent style screens. The hd resolution is typical for any standard computer and on a 14 inch screen it looks better than on a 15 inch or 17 inch. You just loose some screen space but improve the clarity. The screen itself is pretty thin too. Stack two nickels together and that about how thin it is. Although it is pretty solidBuild: The computer is all plastic. Its your typical plastic that most laptops use today but everything on the computer feels pretty solid and not chincy. There is no metal screen back or anything like that.Ports: The hdmi port works great. Hooked it up to my led tv the other day and worked right away and looks nice. Usb 2.0 port works like every other usb 2.0 port I have used and seems very standard and is located on the left hand side. I currently use it for a wireless mouse dongle. The 2 usb 3.0 ports are located on the right hand side, side by side, next to the hdmi port. I transferred some file in about 15 seconds that would have taken probably a minute with usb 2.0. If you do not know usb 3.0 is alot fast than 2.0 but if you are just transferring small word documents or small pictures you wont really notice it. I find it pretty convenient this laptop includes both and not just one or the other. It also has your typical cat 5 which includes a clasp type of mechanism where the plug in goes I'm assuming for extra security which is nice too. There is a mic/headphone port (not seperate). I read somewhere that this was a bad thing as it a combined port an not seperate for a mic and a seperate pair of headphones but the way I see it is there is already a built in microphone by the webcam so you don't need a seperate mic anyways. So if you have earbuds or headphones with a built in mic it works that way as well.Trackpad: Has raised bumps which I prefer over a smooth one because you can get the feel of it more. Also you can turn the trackpad off by double tapping the circle indentation in the upper left hand corner. All finger control for windows 8 feel fine and I don't have a problem with them. Just takes time to get used to if you aren't already. You also have your typical left and right buttons that have a nice solid click.Keyboard. Chiclet style. I prefer this setup as the keys are more on their own "island". Just like mac keyboards. They are more spaced out than a standard keyboard but I was able to get used to it after a couple minutes of typing. Keys are very easy to press and I don't feel a slight bit of finger strain at all. The up and down arrows are smaller than white I am used to but not a problem at all. Features on the keyboard also include screen brightness adjustment, mute, sound up/down, wifi on/off and is a standard size keyboard. It also has play and stop etc.Sound: I didn't notice this in the advertisement but this laptop has altec lansing speakers with dolby advanced audio. They sound great for such a small laptop and wathcing a movie would be enjoyable or listening to music or playing games.Performance: This has 6gb of ram and the 3rd gen i5 17 watt processor. The 6gb of ram should be enough for almost anyone which i nice that you don't have to upgrade it right away. The processor is the 3rd gen i5 with Ivy Bridge. I look at this processor as an efficient but powerful processor. I was able to download some files off the internet, watch 3 movies in 1080p and play music on pandora all at once. So this should be fine for almost anything you want to do. I am not a gamer so I can't comment on that. The 17 watts i5 processor had me concerned when I first got it thinking it might be too slow since the regular ones run at 35 watts but that all gone and I am very pleased to do anything I really want without having to wait for anything to catch up. I also read a review on the 17 watt i5 vs the 35 watt and the tests came back almost identical. So you get the performance while using less power. Also my older style hp would heat up lie an oven. I've been running this one pretty hard that last hour and it has yet to get hot. Stays cool to the touch. The vent is also located on the side which is great for people who actually use laptops on their lap.Battery: Every laptop that you can get a good deal on always has a cruch. The battery life on this is about 4 hours. Thats surfing the web, watching some online videos and listening to music. It is pretty good for a 4 cell battery and just how small it is but there is better out there. I find that I am able to go to school and work on anything I have to before I leave so it works for me. So if you use this for travel or dont have a power outlet near you, you might want to consider buying another battery or a portable power supply.Webcam: Webcam is front and center and works. It's not 1080p hd or anything but it works and has the same resolution you will find standard anywhere else.Overall I love the laptop. It's lightweight, powerful, slim and has all the features you need. The only reason I took away the one star is because of the battery life. Its great to have this much power in a smaller laptop but it needs a bigger battery some days. Also any upgrading of the hard drive, memory etc...requires you go through the keyboard which can be a pain but it's not that difficult to do. If you are looking for a lightweight laptop that has great performance, resolution and you dont plan on using it for more than 4 hours at a time without a charge then this would be it.****After a couple months now I have really enjoyed this laptop. I still have to reach for my charger every now and then but most of the time the battery life is long enough where I can get done what I need to. It last about 4 hours on a dim screen. Overall performance is still excellent. Loads and plays a 1080p movie on youtube without hesitation. The issue with my last hp laptop is it would get really hot. This one gets warm if I leave it on the bed, but not hot or even really warm. The paint by the keyboard and mousepad haven't dulled at all. I paid $400 for this on black friday. I would pay the asking price for this laptop if I needed a lightweight, fast and efficient laptop.Update 4-13-13Still running strong. No issues yet and I still like everything about it.I wanted to inform some people who have not experienced Windows 8 yet. All of the advertisements shown for Windows 8 has the "tile" layout, similiar to smartphones and tablets. It's great for those devices but Windows 8 also has a "retro" user interface which is the traditional layout most people are used to and is found on Windows 7, Vista, XP etc. So you can have icons just like the Windows 7 but there is no start menu. You can add a start menu through a free download, google it, that works fairly well. That way you can access everything traditionally like you normally would in Windows 7 and XP by clicking on Start. Also Windows 8 is incredibly fast when starting up. Windows XP and 7 take an average of 45 seconds plus. Windows 8 Takes about 15 seconds for me to get signed on with this laptop. So it if fast which is nice if you have to log on quickly. Any questions please leave a comment.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE this Laptop !!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: In my lifetime (I'm 65 years old) I have owned too many desktops to count and this was my 30th Laptop. I must say that this is the BEST of the BEST !!I have never owned a Laptop that was so responsive and trouble free !! It basically set itself up, maintains itself automatically and allows me to just use it instead of always having to upgrade and maintain it myself ! When I turn it on it boots up and is running in 2 to 3 seconds .... WOW !!  Battery life is around three hours which is great and this machine even gives me a warning at 14% battery life left, so I can hook it up to the charger and run it from there without missing a beat ! This little machine has NEVER gotten near hot, just mildly warm !!Now, I am not a big fan of HP ( I have several old HP machines in my garage) but this really is the best engineered machine I have ever owned. HP has thought of everything !  The only thing missing was the mouse and a CD/DVD Drive so I purchased a LG GP10NB20 Portable DVD+/-RW External Drive  and a Logitech Wireless Mouse M325 from Amazon.com, both of which worked flawlessly with this computer !Well, I can't say enough good things about this machine, but soon I would just appear to be rambling ... so I will close with this :If you are looking for a super fast and powerful Laptop computer at an exceptionally low price, buy yourself one of these !!You won't regret it !

Reviews.Title: Great laptop...great customer service. See additional comments.
Reviews.Author: Colorado Buyer
Reviews.Content: 60 year old male.  Tech savvy.1. Lightweight. Very portable.  Durable plastic casing. Reasonably priced.2. Good Graphics and Very Fast i-5 Processor. Excellent wireless.3. Great Storage and RAM4. Excellent Keyboard, very responsive5. Despise Windows 8.  Using Pokki as a Windows 7 alternative, but still not the same.  Waiting for Windows 8.1. We'll see...6. Cannot find a battery replacement for this laptop.  Current battery: 2 hours and out....I would not recommend this laptop for reasons 5 and 6...otherwise a "5 Star Review"

Reviews.Title: Stylish and light
Reviews.Author: Paul S.
Reviews.Content: The only problem was that the photo of the laptop was not accurate. It doesn't have the number keyboard on the side , it only has the numbers on top. Be careful if that is what you are looking for, otherwise its very nice. I don't really like wondows 8 inicial windows, it kind of confusing.

Reviews.Title: Really nice for the price
Reviews.Author: Aleisha Fritzen
Reviews.Content: I love it. It is very fast and getting used to using the windows 8 (I had vista before so it is a little transition). It is a notebook style though it says laptop because it has no cd,dvd, or bluray drive (which for the price is fine you can always look online and get an external for a good price). VERY LIGHT! Love how light and easy to carry. It is thin and the screen size it perfect not too big but not too small. I would highly recommend it. I have had for 2 months so far so awesome will update later.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Laptop, I love it
Reviews.Author: Jayhola
Reviews.Content: This laptop is way beyond my expectation. Before bought this laptop, I had a Thinkpad X61s. Since the X61s is so slow for my daily calculation, I have to buy a affordable new laptop. I only spend 500 on this one. And the performance is just great.This laptop is thin and light. And compare to my X61s, the screen is bigger and much more clear. The 14" LED screen is bright and clean. I don't know what to say. Thanks to the technology. I can not use my old laptop outdoor in a shine day because I can barely see nothing. However, now I can bring my laptop to the outside of the library.And I was expecting a heavy fan noise since it is a hp product. However, it runs very quietly under regular use. Maybe the i5 CPU helped a lot. I don't feel the warm or the noise. It just perfect.This i5 cpu + 6g ram laptop runs very fast. With the win8, it starts in seconds. I run Matlap, Ansys and ArcGIS with it. Not a single problem at all. Maybe my old computers are too old? I just feel it so fast and enjoyable to use.The audio speaker is loud and clear and the camera is clear as well. I don't know what else I would want from a 500 product. It's just perfect.Thanks HP and Intel. You make my money worth.

Reviews.Title: DON'T BE FOOLED BY THE PICTURE
Reviews.Author: Y. Kuo
Reviews.Content: The laptop itself is alright, but the picture it shows on here is not the picture of the actual product you'll get. This laptop does not have a numeric keyboard on the right side. Be careful when you are purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop
Reviews.Author: Jalard
Reviews.Content: I've been using this laptop every day for the last 11 months (Black Friday 2012), and I have no major complaints. I guess the biggest complaint I have about the laptop is the battery life (I usually get about 3 hours), but I'm usually near a power outlet, so this isn't a big issue to me. This laptop is fast, compact, and made pretty durable. It really has everything I need/want in a laptop and I see no reason to upgrade for a while. I carry this around with me in my backpack (it has a laptop compartment) and it takes up little space and weight. The 500gb hard drive is amply space for me and the 6gb of RAM seems to handle just about everything I throw at it. I thought I would miss having a DVD drive, but then I realized I download/stream all my movies anyways- and a USB flash drive essentially does the same thing with less hassle. The only upgrade I'm considering is an SSD once they go down in price. It also would've been nice if this came with a backlit keyboard, but I can live fine without it. Overall, this is an excellent laptop that I would recommend to anyone looking for a powerful, lightweight laptop.Oh, and I actually think Windows 8 isn't as bad as people say it is. I purchased a start menu program called Start8 and it pretty much turns it into Windows 7.5. I have the same exact start menu as I would on Windows 7, but I have the option to load the Windows 8 menu if I want (from the start menu). It costs $5 but its worth it. There's a free start menu program called classic shell, but I've used both and Start8 never crashes, while classic shell sometimes des-so IMO you should just buy it. I've also had no major issues with Windows 8- besides the lack of start menu- which takes $5 and 5 minutes to fix.An overall very nice laptop for every day use.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Gissel
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, be delighted with the presentation, is very fast and efficient, has a compact size that makes it easy to transport.

Reviews.Title: Just Great!
Reviews.Author: Richard Carner
Reviews.Content: This computer is just great for the casual home user. Love the size and weight and it fulfills all of my needs.

Reviews.Title: bought as a gift
Reviews.Author: George J. Marcus "GJ Marcus"
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter was delighted to get this, especially for its  weight and excellent performance, meeting all her needs as a college student.

Reviews.Title: problem with the hard drive
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed that the hard drive failed after only one year and three months. HP would not replace it for free because the manufacturers warranty of one year expired. I will never buy another HP computer  again.

Reviews.Title: Loved it but had to return it
Reviews.Author: OldLadyFromNM
Reviews.Content: I bought this refurb'ed from Secondipity, which is affiliated with Amazon.  I was going along well, learning Windows 8 fast and really liking the machine when the fan started getting loud and the machine would freeze up over and over.  I've since learned it was probably losing the hard drive.  Regardless, they sent a label and I returned the unit.  Around ten days later they sent an email saying they hadn't received it.  I emailed a scan of the UPS Store proof, and within about 48 hours I had my refund.  Save your paperwork!  Except for the one hiccup, they made it fairly painless!  I wound up buying the HP Pavilion 360 with the hinge.  It's an 11.6" screen, versus the 14" of the Sleekbook, but to me it was worth the tradeoff of the extra size to get the versatility of the convertible.

Reviews.Title: HP Pavilion 14-b017cl 14" Sleekbook Laptop
Reviews.Author: William H. Lee
Reviews.Content: The laptop was exactly what I ordered & I've been very pleased with it.  It's light-weight & has ports for connection to my external monitor, scanner, printer & external hard drive storage device.

Reviews.Title: Lost a Star for Win8
Reviews.Author: arpuffer
Reviews.Content: The title of this review says it all.  The computer is fantastic--I've been avoiding HP laptops for years due to sketchy build quality, but this was the only computer that had all of the specifications I wanted (processing power, HD4000 onboard graphics, ultrabook dimensions), and after taking a good look at it, I thought just maybe this one would stay in one piece for a while. Turns out I was right!Originally was looking at Ultrabooks, but this one fit everything in the Ultrabook spec minus the SSD for faster boot times--a small sacrifice.Pros:> Performance> Size (ultrabook size spec)> Robust mechanical and electronic designCons:> Keys contact screen when lid is closed, leaving dirt and oil in squares on the LCD> Windows 8 is a huge pain in the neck on a non-touchscreen device.  I'll spare you the long rant here, but it constantly gets in the way.  Maybe it's not fair to dock a star for that, but it negatively affects the experience that much.> No Bluetooth--my cheapo netbook from 5 years ago had it, would expect any computer to have it now.

Reviews.Title: Nice for the price.
Reviews.Author: A STONE
Reviews.Content: For the price I paid, I cannot complain.  Windows 8.1 has made it an even better net-book.  If you can get this for a price below $425.00, consider it a steal.  I 've had it for one year now and no issues.

Reviews.Title: High Performance on the cheap
Reviews.Author: CinemaStar
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a computer that I can use for everyday use as well as designing and programming, as well to update hardware at any time. I owned a Macbook Pro before though I wouldn't call this a downgrade. I highly recommend it for the casual user who are looking for performance in a compact design. The screen isn't fantastic, nor is the battery life (way down from the 7 I was getting before). Windows 8 isn't all that different from 7 and I can't really understand what the big deal was. There was just many instances where I said "Mac can do this easier".With the i5 processor and an impressive 6gb memory, the performance is there when you need it. Just stay close to an outlet if you're going to be using it for awhile.

Reviews.Title: Good choice for university students
Reviews.Author: gemp
Reviews.Content: Good laptop! Very slim and useful for university students that carry around their laptops. You must know how to use the new Windows; otherwise, you are lost. My parents find it difficult to handle this OS.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price.
Reviews.Author: Hugh Smith
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my daughter and a short term replacement but she love it and it is now a long term purchase.

Reviews.Title: My sister's laptop
Reviews.Author: roy
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my sister and i worked perfectly. It's exactly what she needed to study. Good Price vs Hardware.

Reviews.Title: HP Sleekbook
Reviews.Author: Christopher Stewart
Reviews.Content: Decent screen size, no issues with the battery life, light weight and travels easy. HP nailed it with the Sleekbook.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: Taylor Griffin
Reviews.Content: I purchased this laptop blindly, offline. I'm the type of customer who researches and researches online, but generally have to see it in person to test it out. And I love it! Couldn't be more happier. I was looking at laptops from Dell to start with, but the cost of essentially the same laptop was almost double! I really like this laptop and everything that comes with it. I bought it to use at the University, but to my surprise, I've been using it a lot more for music than I had with my Toshiba. Now thinking back to my Toshiba it was like a dinosaur in comparison to this speedy little guy. It's small, but the screen is still huge, with overall a great appearance. I am also surprised about how much I actually like windows 8. When I had bought it I had heard so many bad things about it and thought, you know this is such a great price, I'll just buy it and switch to windows 7, but I actually grew to love windows 8!! You must try it for yourself, don't listen to what other people say. The only thing I don't like now is that this laptop doesn't have a disc drive. I knew prior to purchasing it that it wouldn't have one but sometimes I wish I did. But hey, It makes up for it with how slim and light-weight it is. I highly recommend this laptop to anyone. Go try one out at a store or something if you have any doubts!

Reviews.Title: Good computer for a great price
Reviews.Author: J. Miller
Reviews.Content: I'm a consultant who travels to client sites and helps them with marketing and management issues.  No heavy graphics and I'm not a gamer.  This laptop serves me very well.  It boots in a reasonable time and has a battery life of about 4 hours.  I like to use the feature that disables the touchpad (just double click the top left of the pad) and use a mouse when I'm drafting substantial documents, as when I'm typing I often bump the pad and it changes the function or relocates the cursor.  I recommend this unit.

Reviews.Title: Great laptop!
Reviews.Author: HP-fans
Reviews.Content: Nice function, size and weight. Thin, light but very fast. 3rd core i5 processor, Windows 8, USB 3.0, HDMI Port, Long Battery Life. Plenty of features make it perfect for me. Would reconmmend it.

Reviews.Title: ok product
Reviews.Author: Noe Valverde
Reviews.Content: Using this product for 4 months and not much excited about it, I had many problems plus trying to make it work lost my Microsoft office and other programs not happy about it. since that lost, now trying new system in this computer lets see how it goes. good bye Windows.Since I don't like it I do not recommend it, plus I do not share the idea of for cost and quality no mater the cost it should be good quality to work other ways it is just ravish. Updating my review on Dec 11 2013, I had hard experience in this product, now changed to Ubuntu thinking maybe was the Windows 8 but still some problems same, freezing just with web browsing. but audio problems solved at least until now with new system not the original one.hope you get the best decision,Noe

Reviews.Title: Disaponted!
Reviews.Author: Aldin
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to say I've owned a HP pc 5-6 years ago and I loved it,I don't remember the name or number but it was a really great pc that served me well. Now, I bought HP Pavilion 14-b017cl 14" a month ago, was playing with it for couple of weeks and really liked it, but then I got a message that I need to update some drivers and after updating I've had only problems. As of now, my sound doesn't work (I get "no audio output device is installed") the graphic card is also "missing" (I can watch videos but can't see the other person when I use Skype) and also if I leave it on for some time (1-2 hours) without interacting with it it just freezes and I have to restart by holding the start button.the troubleshooting function can't find any problems and when I spoke with the support they would walk me through, step by step, uninstalling and then reinstalling the audio device and it works (for that session, but the next time I turn on the  computer it's all the same). for the problems with the graphic card they advice to back everything up and restore the fabric configuration (that should fix the sound problem as well)... the only problem is I have like 30 GB of data that I transfered from my old PC, so now I have to buy an external HD to back it all up, (who doesn't like some extra expenses)I'm really dissapointed and thinking about returning it (I live in Chile so it's not that easy either)I hope someone from HP reads this and take a look into it and fix it so other people don't get this problemwhen I get this fixed I might change the rating, but as of now I really wouldn't recommend this PC to anyoneAldin

Reviews.Title: Great Laptop
Reviews.Author: Marjorie Lauring
Reviews.Content: This laptop has fulfilled all my expectations. I was really concerned about learning Windows8. I even ordered out the book "Windows 8 For Seniors for Dummies". By the time it arrived I had most everything figured out. But it will come in handy for cleaning up all those tiles and some other issues as I get into using the programs more.I really love how fast it is as I was using an old laptop with XP. It did take me a little time to learn Win 8 but wasn't as frustrating as I anticipated.

Reviews.Title: USELESS LAPTOP
Reviews.Author: Achint Sehgal
Reviews.Content: I had to call HP and get it replaced...So many things don't work in the laptop...Hardware was defected aswell...Its so irritating, to wait for so long and even then get something which doesn't work...I will never ever buy electronics from Amazon...Worst experience ever...!!

Reviews.Title: HP Laptop
Reviews.Author: Derek Litteral
Reviews.Content: Great buy. I love it and it does its job. Only thing negative to say is that I wish it had a cd/dvd drive.

Reviews.Title: Has many issues
Reviews.Author: Sagi
Reviews.Content: Got this as an upgrade for my daughter's old laptop.Feeling out of the box: It's very plasticky. Keyboard has a "give" so it bends a bit when you punch in the keys.My benchmark is a MacBook Air which I'm using (very happily).The screen doesn't look great. I guess this is a question of taste. Something about the display is not smooth.The main issue, though, is that there are serious malfunctions. The caps lock intermittently engages and disengages at seemingly random times, and once it's on you cannot turn it off, and your only workaround is to hold the shift key when typing.Also I had cases where the trackpad is stuck and I cannot move the pointer. I brought up the task manager but I don't see that any process is canibalizing the CPU.I haven't been able to get a hold of HP support, and frankly I dread the whole process of trying to get help on this.I ended up buying her a different laptop and I'll repurpose this as a secondary machine, but I don't see myself using this much.In hindsight, I would have been better off ponying up the $1100 to get her a MacBook Air as well. Much less gambling with quality when you are getting a Mac...

ProductInfo.Features:
3rd generation Intel® Core™ i5-3317U Processor; Windows 8
14.0" diagonal HD BrightView LED-backlit display (1366 x 768 )
6GB DDR3 SDRAM (2 DIMM) ; 500GB 5400RPM hard drive
2 SuperSpeed USB 3.0; 1 USB 2.0; 1 HDMI
Webcam; Full-size island-style keyboard
ProductInfo.Name: HP Pavilion 14-b017cl 14" Sleekbook Laptop / Intel Core i5-3317U, 6GB DDR3 SDRAM, 500GB Hard Drive, HDMI, Webcam, USB 3.0, Windows 8
